centralQuestion: Should Oregon introduce a statewide sales tax in order to increase funding for state programs?

reasons.description: Consumption taxes are generally less harmful to economic growth than income taxes, so shifting part of the tax mix toward a broad sales tax can raise revenue with lower efficiency costs.

sources.title: American Enterprise Institute (AEI): 'Slow-Growth U.S. Now Ripe for a Consumption Tax'

reasons.description: A statewide sales tax is a proven high-yield instrument that can raise substantial revenue to fund programs when designed with a broad base.

sources.title: Congressional Budget Office (CBO): 'Impose a 5 Percent Value-Added Tax (VAT)'
International Monetary Fund (IMF): 'The Evolution of Potential VAT Revenues and C-Efficiency in Advanced Economies'

reasons.description: Modernizing the tax base (including services and digital goods) can improve adequacy and keep pace with the economy, making a sales tax more robust.

sources.title: Tax Policy Center: 'How do state and local general sales and gross receipts taxes work?'
Urban Institute: 'How Broad Are State Sales Tax Bases?'

reasons.description: In practice, proposals to introduce or expand sales taxes are used to stabilize revenues and finance priorities, sometimes paired with income-tax cuts.

sources.title: Associated Press (AP): 'Gov. Youngkin wants to cut income taxes and raise the sales tax in proposed Virginia budget'

objections.description: General sales taxes are regressive, raising a larger share of income from low- and moderate-income households than from higher-income households.

sources.title: Brookings Institution: 'The Pros and Cons of a Consumption Tax'

objections.description: Political carve-outs and exemptions can erode the base, forcing higher rates and complicating administration.
Sales-tax revenues can be cyclical and sensitive to shifts in consumption patterns, posing fiscal stability risks.

sources.title: Pew Research Center: 'Tax Revenue Volatility Is Increasing in Most States'
International Monetary Fund (IMF): 'The Evolution of Potential VAT Revenues and C-Efficiency in Advanced Economies'

objections.description: Introducing a sales tax can disadvantage border-area retailers by encouraging cross-border shopping in lower-tax jurisdictions, affecting employment and payroll near state lines.

sources.title: Federal Reserve Board: 'The Effect of State and Local Sales Taxes on Employment at State Borders'

research.title: ‘Salience and Taxation: Theory and Evidence’ (American Economic Review, 2009)
research.description: Experimental and field evidence showing that consumers underreact to non-salient sales taxes, affecting demand and incidence; provides insights into behavioral responses to sales taxes.

research.title: ‘Value-Added Taxation: A Tax Whose Time Has Come?’ (Journal of Economic Perspectives, 1995)
research.description: Survey of VAT design, incidence, and implementation issues, discussing efficiency, distribution, and administrative considerations relevant to adopting broad-based consumption taxes.

research.title: ‘Retail Price Reactions to Changes in State and Local Sales Taxes’ (National Tax Journal, 1996)
research.description: Empirical test of tax shifting showing the degree to which sales taxes are passed through to consumer prices, informing incidence and revenue expectations.

research.title: ‘Local sales taxes, employment, and tax competition’ (Regional Science and Urban Economics, 2018)
research.description: Border-county analysis finding that higher relative sales taxes can reduce employment and payroll near borders, with effects concentrated where cross-border commuting is large.
